title: Quiz 5: Neuro, Endocrine & Skin Disorders
description: Assessment of neurological, endocrine, dermatological, and sensory disorders.

questions.question: Which type of Hydrocephalus is caused by an obstruction WITHIN the ventricular system?
questions.explanation: Non-communicating hydrocephalus involves blockage within the ventricles (e.g., aqueduct stenosis), preventing CSF flow to the subarachnoid space.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of a Grand Mal seizure in the correct order:
Which of the following are clinical features of Diabetes Mellitus in children? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Diabetes presents with Thirst, Urination, Weight LOSS (not gain), and Bed wetting.
questions.hint: Think of the 3 Ps: Polyuria, Polydipsia, Polyphagia (with weight loss).

questions.question: Match the skin condition with its key feature or treatment:
questions.explanation: Scabies=Itch Mite; Impetigo=Bacterial crusts; Ringworm=Fungal circles; Jiggers=Sand fleas.

questions.question: Congenital Hypothyroidism (Cretinism) requires life-long treatment with Thyroxine.
questions.explanation: The thyroid deficiency is permanent, so replacement therapy is life-long to prevent mental retardation.

questions.question: What is the term for a continuous seizure lasting more than 30 minutes or repeated seizures without recovery of consciousness?
questions.explanation: Status Epilepticus is a medical emergency involving prolonged seizure activity.

questions.question: Otitis Media is inflammation of the ___BLANK___ ear.
questions.explanation: Otitis Media specifically affects the middle ear.

questions.question: Why are young children more prone to Otitis Media?

options.text: Their eustachian tubes are longer and vertical
Their eustachian tubes are shorter, wider, and more horizontal

questions.explanation: The horizontal, short, wide tube allows easy reflux of pathogens from the throat to the ear.

questions.question: Which of the following are part of the 'ABC' rule for first aid in convulsions? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: ABC: Airway, Breathing, Circulation. NEVER restrain a convulsing patient.

questions.question: Identify the condition depicted in this diagram showing enlarged brain ventricles.

richContent.content: [Image Description: Diagram of a brain with significantly dilated lateral ventricles compressing brain tissue]

questions.explanation: Dilated ventricles due to fluid accumulation is the hallmark of Hydrocephalus.
